articles.title: DPRK FM Meets His Counterparts of Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets His Counterparts of Different Countries
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Ho, foreign minister of the DPRK who is taking part in the 71st UN General Assembly being held in New York, separately met and had talks with the foreign ministers of Singapore, Bhutan, Thailand and Guyana, the Mongolian and Angolan ministers for External Relations, the Cambodian senior minister who doubles as minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, the Syrian vice prime minister who doubles as minister of Foreign Affairs and Expatriates, the Algerian minister of State who doubles as minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation and the Ugandan minister of State for the Foreign Ministry.
					 They discussed the issue of boosting the bilateral relations and matters of mutual concern such as support and cooperation in the international arena.
					
					 Meanwhile, Ri Yong Ho separately met the president of the UN General Assembly, the under-secretary-general for UN Humanitarian Aid, the administrator of the UNDP, the executive director of the United Nations Population Fund and the president of the International Committee of the Red Cross to discuss issues of cooperation between the DPRK and those bodies.

articles.title: Answer of DPRK FM Spokesman Distributed as Official Document of UN General Assembly and UNSC
articles.content:
Answer of DPRK FM Spokesman Distributed as Official Document of UN General Assembly and UNSC
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The answer of a spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK to the question raised by KCNA on Sept. 7 as regards the fact that the UN Security Council cooked up a press release taking issue with the DPRK's routine ballistic rocket launch drill was distributed as an official document A/70/1037-S/2016/771 of the UN General Assembly and UN Security Council on September 26.

articles.title: Youth League Meets
articles.content:
Youth League Meets
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The second enlarged plenary meeting of the 9th Central Committee of the Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Youth League was held here on Tuesday. 
					 Present there were members of the Central Committee and officials of the youth league, ministries and national institutions.
					
					 It discussed the task of the organizations of the youth league to carry out the tasks set forth at "Let Us Usher in a Golden Age of the Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Youth Movement", a speech made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un at the 9th Congress of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the Central Committee of the youth league, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that Kim Jong Un's speech is an immortal library of the youth movement that indicated the path to usher in a golden age in the Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist youth movement as required by the new era of the Juche revolution.
					
					 They stressed the need to develop the youth league as the one of the great leaders and Kim Jong Un and to demonstrate the might of reliable reserves, advancing group and wing of the Party in the struggle for carrying out the decisions of the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 9th Congress of the youth league.
					
					 They stressed the need to discharge the honorable mission and duty of young vanguard in the general advance for accomplishing the socialist cause by fluttering the flag of the youth league under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: "2016 World Day of Tourism" Marked
articles.content:
"2016 World Day of Tourism" Marked
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- An event took place at Yanggakdo International Hotel to mark the "2016 World Day of Tourism" on Tuesday.
					 There were briefing and photo show on tourism in the DPRK. 
					
					 Present at the event were officials concerned and staff members of foreign embassies and missions of international bodies here.
					
					 Jo Song Gol, general director of the State General Bureau of Tourism, said many world-level cultural tourist facilities are now springing up in different parts of the country under the plan of the Workers' Party of Korea for building a highly civilized socialist nation. Every year the number of domestic and foreign tourists is increasing and tourist industry is making progress, he noted.
					
					 He expressed the will to briskly conduct tourism in the future, too, on the basis of a wealth of experience gained in the service provided by various organizations.
					
					 Taleb Rifai, secretary general of the World Tourism Organization, in his video speech to all countries on the World Day of Tourism called upon the governments and tourist companies to make tour for all a major theme of the tourist policy and business strategy so that all people including disabled persons and the old may enjoy beauty of the world.
					
					 The participants enjoyed introductory documentary "Korean Tourism" and looked round photos introducing great monumental structures and famous tourist destinations of Korea.

articles.title: National Science and Technology Presentation in Field of Forestry Held
articles.content:
National Science and Technology Presentation in Field of Forestry Held
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- There took place a national science and technology presentation in the field of forestry at the Sci-Tech Complex on Sept. 26 and 27. It was sponsored by the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 It was attended by teachers, researchers and on-the-spot officials and the Three revolution Team members of Kim Il Sung University, the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection, the Ministry of Forestry, State Academy of Sciences, Academy of Agricultural Science, Kanggye University of Agriculture and Forestry, South Hwanghae Provincial Land Development Designing Institute, Anju City Forestry Management Station, etc.
					
					 The participants heard valuable papers dealing with successes achieved by scientists, technicians and workers in the field of forestry in the work to develop afforestation, forest conservation and management.
					
					 There was also a lecture on a series of issues arising in applying the method of planting tall trees irrespective of seasons and the agro-forestry management method.

articles.title: Yun I Sang Concert Given
articles.content:
Yun I Sang Concert Given
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- There took place the 35th Yun I Sang Concert at the Yun I Sang Concert Hall on Tuesday.
					 Among the audience were Minister of Cultural Pak Chun Nam, officials concerned, creators, artistes, teachers and students in the fields of stage art and art education and Pyongyangites and overseas Koreans.
					
					 The concert began with "Arirang".
					
					 The performers made the use of musical expression of trio for violin, cello and piano, chamber symphony No. 2, female solo "Spinning Wheel Ballad" and others.
					
					 The concert was highly acclaimed by the audience for high artistry and refined rendition.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Kim Jong Un from Algerian President
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, received a message of sympathy from Abdelaziz Bouteflika, president of the People's Democratic Republic of Algeria, on September 15.
					 The Algerian president in the message said he received the sad news of considerable losses in lives and materials by the flood in the northern area of the DPRK.
					
					 He expressed deep consolation, full solidarity and sympathy to Kim Jong Un and the bereaved families over huge disasters in the country, on behalf of the government and people of Algeria and on his own behalf.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Republic of Maldives
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Republic of Maldives
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom, president of the Republic of Maldives, on Sept. 9.
					 The president in his message extended the heartfelt and warm congratulations and greetings to HE Kim Jong Un and the people of the DPRK on its auspicious national day on behalf of the government and people of Maldives and on his own behalf.
					
					 The message sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and the people of the DPRK more development and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from King of Bahrain
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from King of Bahrain 
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from Hamad Bin Isa al-Khalifa, king of the Kingdom of Bahrain, on September 8.
					 The king of Bahrain in the message he was pleased to extend sincere greeting and warm congratulations and blessing to Kim Jong Un on the national day of the friendly DPRK on his own behalf and on behalf of the people of Bahrain.
					
					 He sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness, sincerely wishing the people of the DPRK steady progress and prosperity under his wise leadership.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations, Delegates Here for Int'l Academic Symposium
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations, Delegates Here for Int'l Academic Symposium
Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Delegations and Delegates from Russia, Belgium, China, France, Poland, Australia, Spain and Vietnam arrived here to participate in the international academic symposium marking the 70th anniversary of Kim Il Sung University.

articles.title: Delegation of World Communion of Reformed Churches Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Delegation of World Communion of Reformed Churches Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the World Communion of Reformed Churches led by President Jerry Pillay visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being told about the stories of the historic home, the guests went round historical relics preserved there with much care.
					
					 They toured revolutionary relics on Mangyong Hill.
					
					 They visited the Tower of the Juche Idea, Sci-Tech Complex, Rungna Dolphinarium, etc.

articles.title: Posters Encouraging Drive for Recovering from Flood Damage in Northern Part of Country Produced
articles.content:
Posters Encouraging Drive for Recovering from Flood Damage in Northern Part of Country Produced 
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Posters encouraging service personnel and people of the DPRK in the drive for recovering from flood damage in the northern part of North Hamgyong Province were produced.
					 A poster "Let us mobilize all forces and means!" calls for producing even a single ton of more cement and a single kilogram of rice and saving even a small amount of money for the speedy recovery from flood damage. 
					
					 Another poster "Let us make new villages and streets spring up like mushrooms after rain in the northern area!" calls for providing flood-hit people with cradles as early as possible and turning the afflicted areas into fairyland in the era of the Workers' Party.
					
					 A poster "Let us finish the drive for recovering from flood damage with might of army-people joint operations rare to be found in the world!" reflects the confidence and will of the service personnel and people of the DPRK to complete the rehabilitation at an early date through the army-people joint operations.

articles.title: Leading Units in On-going 200-day Campaign in DPRK
articles.content:
Leading Units in On-going 200-day Campaign in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Many industrial establishments in the DPRK were selected as leading units for their achievements made in the on-going 200-day campaign.
					 Recently, the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) sent congratulatory messages to those units in the fields of key and basic industries, light industry, agricultural industry, fishery and scientific research.
					
					 Among them are the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex, the West Pyongyang Service Brigade of Engine under the Pyongyang Railway Bureau, the Chollima Steel Complex, the Tokchon Area Coal-Mining Complex, the Musan Mining Complex, the Sunchon Cement Complex, the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex, the Pyongyang Electric Cable Factory 326, the IT Sci-Tech Institute under the State Academy of Sciences, the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill, the Samjigang Co-op Farm in Jaeryong County and the Nampho Taegyong Fishery Station.
					
					 The WPK's congratulatory messages encourage all the working people of the country to perform greater feats.
					
					 It is the traditional work method of the WPK to hold up advanced units as examples and generalize them.

articles.title: Railroad Restoration Progresses Apace
articles.content:
Railroad Restoration Progresses Apace
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The restoration of railroad has been completed one after another in the flood-hit North Hamgyong Province of the DPRK.
					 According to data available at the Ministry of Railways, railroad bed has been restored in 50 sections with six stations reconstructed.
					
					 As of Sept. 23, 478.35 kilometers of railway were rebuilt and the first train arrived at Musan Station after the start of the flood-damage restoration.
					
					 Meanwhile, builders have laid over 200,000 cubic meters of earth for railroad bed, completed 30,000 square meters of revetment and planted a hundred and dozens of electric poles.

articles.title: Wonsan Air Festival-2016
articles.content:
Wonsan Air Festival-2016
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The Wonsan International Friendship Air Festival-2016 took place with large attendance in Wonsan, a port city of the DPRK, on September 24-25. 
					 David Thomson Rolands, president of the British Juche Travel Services and honorary vice-chairman of the air festival, made an opening address.
					
					 When interviewed by KCNA, he said that the preparations for the festival and all conditions of the airport were excellent, expressing his gratitude to the DPRK side for making big efforts for the festival.
					
					 At the festival, pilots of the Korean People's Army (KPA) drove different fighters to make solo, formation, level, climbing, descending, circular and contour flights.
					
					 Formation flights of supersonic fighters made by KPA girl pilots were highly admired by spectators.
					
					 Makoto Iijima, a Japanese tourist, said that he was deeply moved to see the people rush out into the runway to greet those girl pilots.
					
					 Skydivers of the DPRK jumped at an altitude of 1,200m-2,000m, flying the flags of the DPRK and the Workers' Party of Korea. They also displayed fireworks and smoke screens and built a tower with five chutes in the air, which was followed by skydiving skills of parachute experts and fans from Germany, UK, Czech, U.S. and other countries.
					
					 Jaques Douglas, an American, said he had such friendship skydiving for the first time ever and was greatly excited to be one of first foreign skydivers in the festival and had a really good time as everybody is very friendly.
					
					 Fryzek Libor, a Czech parachute fan, said that the newly-built Kalma Airport is very beautiful.
					
					 After the skydiving, foreign parachute experts and fans had a photo session taken with spectators to deepen friendly feelings.
					
					 The participants in the festival commanded a bird's-eye view of Wonsan City by air.
					
					 The festival served as an occasion to promote friendship, exchange and cooperation between countries and nations aspiring after peaceful and prosperous world.

articles.title: Development of Tourist Resources Gains Momentum in DPRK
articles.content:
Development of Tourist Resources Gains Momentum in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- It has been pushed forward to develop tourist resources in the DPRK, said Dr. Chae Jae Duk, a faculty dean of Pyongyang Tourism College, on the occasion of World Day of Tourism (Sept. 27).
					 In the DPRK, there are many tourist destinations like Pyongyang, Wonsan and Kaesong cities and Mts. Paektu, Kumgang and Myohyang, he said, adding:
					
					 According to detailed measures taken by the state, the development of tourist resources like the construction of infrastructure is steadily going on.
					
					 Typical of projects for tourism is the Wonsan-Mt. Kumgang international tourist zone, an integral whole of natural and socio-cultural tourist resources.
					
					 Especially, Wonsan, a port city, has been turned into a tourist destination for summer and winter seasons with the completion of the Masikryong Ski Resort and the remodeling of Songdowon International Children's Camp.
					
					 In the zone, there are the Kosan Combined Fruit Farm and the livestock farming base of the Sepho area favorable for agro-stock tourism.
					
					 The completion and modernization of a number of infrastructural facilities like airport and hotel make it possible for the zone to strengthen its international competitive power.
					
					 Big efforts have also been paid to developing tourist zones in different parts of the country including the special zone for international tour of Mubong and Mt. Chilbo, one of world biosphere sanctuaries.
					
					 Tourist programs have been diversified, which includes air tourism and marathon, bicycle, horse-riding and ski tourisms.
					
					 Recently, the Pyongyang Taedonggang Beer Festival and the Wonsan Air Festival-2016 drew many local and foreign tourists.

articles.title: National Anthem of DPRK
articles.content:
National Anthem of DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- It has been over half a century since the creation of the Patriotic Song, national anthem of the DPRK.
					 The song, eulogizing the 5000-year-old history of Korea, its glorious cultural traditions and rich natural resources, was created at the proposition of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 On September 27, Juche 35 (1946), the President met creators and instructed that it was the unanimous desire of the Korean people to sing their emotions of enjoying freedom and happiness after the country's liberation from Japan's colonial rule.
					
					 Noting that the people led a happy life under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea, but there was no national anthem to meet their sentiment, he called on them to create the song as early as possible.
					
					 Korea is a really beautiful country and the Korean people has the 5000-year-old history with brilliant culture, he said, adding the national pride of the Korean people in having beautiful country and glorious traditions should be reflected in the song.
					
					 The creators found an inspiration from his instruction and set it to the words.
					
					 In June 1947 when the Patriotic Song was taken into deliberations, the President met the creators to give guidance to its composition.
					
					 Now, the Patriotic Song is resounding all over the world as a symbol of the revolutionary spirit of the Korean people who are demonstrating the might of the DPRK, single-mindedly united around supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK Has Acquired Carrier Capability for Launching Various Types of Satellites: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK Has Acquired Carrier Capability for Launching Various Types of Satellites: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The DPRK succeeded in the ground jet test of a new type high-power engine of carrier rocket for the geo-stationary satellite. This was an event that demonstrated the might and spirit of the DPRK as a space power to push back the frontiers of the latest science and technology in the spirit of self-reliance and self-development, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The successful test provided the DPRK with a scientific and technical guarantee for confidently developing and completing the carrier rocket for the geo-stationary satellite in the period of the five year plan of the national aerospace development and helped it fully acquire carrier capability for launching various types of satellites including earth observation satellite at a world level. 
					
					 The DPRK is a full-fledged satellite manufacturer and launcher that produced by itself everything necessary for satellite launches and a space power with tremendous national power to successfully launch any satellite, be it earth observation one or geo-stationary one as it wishes.
					
					 We feel immensely proud and exceptionally worthy of the fact that this is the fruition of the great self-development principle.
					
					 The might of the DPRK as a space power makes all the Koreans in the north, the south and abroad highly proud and honored to be the members of the Korean nation.
					
					 No force on earth can block the great Paektusan nation from advancing by dint of the invincible might of self-development principle. The world will clearly watch the majestic appearance of the thriving country not only on the land but also in vast space before long.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Exposes U.S. and S. Korean Warmongers' Scenario for Preemptive Nuclear Attack
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Exposes U.S. and S. Korean Warmongers' Scenario for Preemptive Nuclear Attack
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Frightened by the rapid development of the nuclear force of the DPRK, the U.S. and the south Korean puppet group were closeted again recently over the issue of carrying out the "three-phase tailored deterrence strategy" for taking what they called a "high-profile action to cope with the nuclear issue of the north."
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says that their open talk about the implementation of the above-said strategy is, in fact, little short of a declaration of a nuclear war against the DPRK with all type war means including nukes involved.
					
					 The essence of the above-mentioned strategy to be carried out under the pretext of "proactively coping with the nuclear crisis" is to mount a surprise preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK.
					
					 They classify "the nuclear crisis" into three phases: "threatening phase," "phase of impending use of nukes" and "phase of their actual use." In case the second phase is judged, it calls for making a preemptive nuclear strike. Herein lies the danger of this war scenario.
					
					 The second phase seems to be very ambiguous as it is bereft of any objective standard.
					
					 This indicates that nuclear mushroom clouds may gather in the air over the Korean peninsula anytime due to the slightest misjudgment of the warmongers.
					
					 The prevailing situation eloquently proves once again that it was absolutely just when the DPRK has bolstered up its nuclear deterrence in every way under the banner of the line of simultaneously developing the two fronts.
					
					 Those warlike forces would be well advised not to misjudge the tremendous military muscle of the DPRK with nuclear force as its pivot strong enough to blow up the whole of the American empire.
					
					 The strategy touted by the trigger-happy forces will serve as a prelude to the nightmare of reducing the White House and Chongwadae to ashes.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Ministry of Unification Should Be Dissolved: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Ministry of Unification Should Be Dissolved: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Recently, the south Korean puppet forces set up at last an ill-famed "agency for north's human rights records" within the Ministry of Unification and remade the section for shaping unification policy a section for policy of peaceful unification, thereby reinforcing the mechanisms for the confrontation with the compatriots and for "human rights" abuses against the DPRK. On the other hands, they nearly dissolved the mechanisms for north-south cooperation which had remained in their names only.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 Through the restructuring of mechanisms, the Park Geun Hye group of traitors definitely turned the puppet Ministry of Unification into the one for confrontation against reunification.
					
					 This shows their reckless frenzy that has reached an extreme phase in doing harm to the fellow countrymen in the north and in escalating confrontation with them.
					
					 By kicking off the "human rights" racket against the DPRK, they are working hard to put a stumbling block in the way of the DPRK which is advancing like the wind along the wide avenue of Songun for a sure victory. This is as foolish an act as trying to bolt a door with a boiled carrot.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that there is no need for the puppet Ministry of Unification to exist as it has been reduced into a shock brigade for realizing Park's policy for confrontation with compatriots in the north and hordes of servants for Chongwadae serving Park going against the national concord and desire for reunification.
					
					 Accusations have long been heard in south Korea that the ministry is doing nothing but idling away in league with human scum, while acting a cat's paw serving Chongwadae. Such ministry escalating confrontation with compatriots and ministry standing against reunification while doing things only harmful to the national reconciliation and unity should not be "reshuffled" but be dissolved.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams S. Korean Puppet Group's Military Nexus with Japan
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams S. Korean Puppet Group's Military Nexus with Japan 
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- South Korean puppet Minister of Foreign Affairs Yun Pyong Se at a recent meeting with the Japanese foreign minister blustered about the "nuke and missile threat from the north", disclosing his sinister intention to take part in the action for the conclusion of an agreement with Japan on protecting military intelligence. 
					 Puppet Defense Minister Han Min Gu is busying himself, discussing the issue of concluding an agreement on protecting military intelligence with Japan on the telephone with Japan's minister of Defense.
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday in a commentary terms the puppet group's moves as a treacherous action to stifle the compatriots in conspiracy with Japan, the sworn enemy of the Korean nation, and to open up the road of reinvasion for the Japanese militarists.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is the fact that the desperate efforts of the Park Geun Hye group of traitors to conclude the agreement are a revelation of a criminal scenario to zealously join the U.S. in its moves to establish the triangular military alliance for aggression.
					
					 The Park group is getting frantic in its moves to deploy THAAD in south Korea and actively joining the U.S. in its moves to establish the missile defense system.
					
					 If the military nexus is tightened through the conclusion of the agreement between south Korea and Japan, it would, in fact, mean the completion of the triangular military alliance among the U.S., Japan and south Korea against the DPRK and Northeast Asia. 
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that this will inspire the Japanese reactionaries' ambition of reinvasion and wreck the peace and security on the Korean peninsula and in Northeast Asia.
					
					 The situation clearly reveals once again the sycophantic and treacherous nature of the Park group of traitors which make desperate efforts to escalate the confrontation with compatriots and ignite a nuclear war against the north while selling off the nation's dignity and interests without hesitation in a bid to prolong its remaining days.

articles.title: Minju Joson Blasts U.S. Modernization of Offensive Weapons
articles.content:
Minju Joson Blasts U.S. Modernization of Offensive Weapons
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson Tuesday in a commentary blasts the U.S. for going reckless in the modernization of offensive weapons these days.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. is busy conducting the flight test of ballistic missile and assessing the combined operation capability of fighter and Aegis weapon system. This is no more than last-ditch efforts of the U.S. administration to shore up its policy of confrontation of strength put on the verge of bankruptcy while seeking military supremacy come what may.
					
					 The U.S. has spent a stupendous amount of money for modernizing military hardware, claiming that it should remain strong to dominate the world and its muscle should be guaranteed by military means.
					
					 Though the U.S. is in the grip of the serious financial crisis, it shaped the world's biggest military budget and has spared no funds and efforts for developing latest military hardware.
					
					 But the U.S. scenario to have a monopoly on the military field proves no longer workable.
					
					 Many countries have opted for bolstering up their military muscle as a reaction to the U.S. policy of military supremacy for aggression and achieved noticeable successes in this field.
					
					 A special mention should be made of the DPRK. It has reached a high level in the work for mounting nuclear warheads on ballistic rockets and emerged a full-fledged nuclear power capable of threatening the U.S.
					
					 Under this situation the U.S. should have sought a realistic and new way out, admitting its policy failure. However, it is still sticking to its trite policy of confrontation of strength, not awakened from the dream of dominating the world with strength.
					
					 This is the tragedy of the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to go off its wrong road as quickly as possible, well aware of what is the root cause of its decline and ruin.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Group's Action That Pushed Peasant into Death Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Group's Action That Pushed Peasant into Death Slammed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- A party of south Korea in a commentary on Sept. 25 denounced the Park Geun Hye group of traitors for pushing peasant Paek Nam Gi into death, according to the south Korean internet paper Minjok Ilbo. 
					 It said that Paek Nam Gi who had been at the point of death due to the crackdown by the security authorities during the people's all-out action on November 14 last year, died on Sunday.
					
					 It urged the murderous Park regime violating democracy and people's living and depriving people of lives to quit at once and demanded Park step down.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Denounces Park Geun Hye Regime for Killing Peasant Paek Nam Gi
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Denounces Park Geun Hye Regime for Killing Peasant Paek Nam Gi
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Kyunghyang Daily News of south Korea on Monday carried an editorial titled "Who did kill Paek Nam Gi".
					 It said peasant Paek Nam Gi breathed his last after 317 days of a critical condition after he was hit by water cannon fired by the police. His death shows the reality in south Korea which is reducing into an area of great human concern of the international community after the Park Geun Hye regime's appearance, the paper noted, adding:
					
					 The prosecution and police should make an apology before the bereaved family members though belatedly if they have an iota of sense of shame.

articles.title: Korean Residents in Ibaragi, Japan Call for Subsidizing Korean Schools
articles.content:
Korean Residents in Ibaragi, Japan Call for Subsidizing Korean Schools
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Korean residents of Ibaragi, Japan launched a signature campaign on Sept. 16 calling for subsidizing the Korean Primary, Secondary and High School in Ibaragi under the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan.
					 On Mar. 29 the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan in a notice addressed to the local governors urged them to examine the issue of subsidizing the Korean schools, posing a sort of threat to them.
					
					 Accordingly the governor of Ibaragi Prefecture at a press interview said on April 8 that it is difficult to give a subsidy to the Korean school in Ibaragi.
					
					 In protest against the sinister moves of the Japanese reactionaries, the Korean Primary, Secondary and High School in Ibaragi, the "society of defending human rights of children of Korean schools", "Let's go together! Ibaragi", the Prefectural Citizens Council for Defending Peace and the society of mothers of the Korean primary, secondary and high schools in Ibaragi staged a joint signature campaign.
					
					 The students and their parents joined in the campaign.
					
					 The participants expressed the will to fight to the last to defend the Korean schools and ensure the rights of the Korean students to learn.
					
					 On the same day, similar campaigns took place in Ehime Prefecture and Matsuyama City.

articles.title: Spokesman for Federation of Koreans in the U.S. Slams Park Geun Hye Regime for Causing Death of Innocent Peasant
articles.content:
Spokesman for Federation of Koreans in the U.S. Slams Park Geun Hye Regime for Causing Death of Innocent Peasant
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. in a statement on Sept. 25 denounced the south Korean puppet group of traitors for causing the death of peasant Paek Nam Gi through fascist crackdown.
					 Recalling that Paek breathed his last after being in a critical condition hit by water cannon fired by fascist police, the statement  accused the Park regime of causing the death of the peasant through brutal crackdown.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 During more than 300 days in which the peasant had been in a critical condition the prosecution remained an onlooker to the incident, not conducting any investigation into the policemen involved in the murder. The prosecution authorities are the same killers and criminals as they patronized the group of killers.
					
					 The statement called for judging the Park Geun Hye regime through strong resistance of people.

articles.title: DPRK's Nuclear Warhead Explosion Test Supported by Czech Body
articles.content:
DPRK's Nuclear Warhead Explosion Test Supported by Czech Body
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- The Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association issued a statement on September 22 congratulating the DPRK on its nuclear warhead explosion test and ground test of a new type high-power engine of a carrier rocket for the geo-stationary satellite.
					 The statement said:
					
					 A series of remarkable successes being achieved by the DPRK in developing latest science and technology greatly encourage the world progressive people and strike the U.S. and other hostile forces with fear and uneasiness.
					
					 This time the DPRK once again demonstrated its might as a military and space power.
					
					 We wish the Korean people bigger successes in their struggle for defending the sovereignty of the country, preserving world peace and security and achieving progress.

articles.title: Russian Magazine Introduces Loving Care Shown by Kim Jong Suk for Uniform of Mangyongdae Revolutionary School
articles.content:
Russian Magazine Introduces Loving Care Shown by Kim Jong Suk for Uniform of Mangyongdae Revolutionary School
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- An article was posted on a Russian internet magazine on Sept. 21 on the 67th anniversary of demise of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk. The article dealt with warm loving care shown by her for the uniform of Mangyongdae Revolutionary School.
					 It said:
					
					 She devoted herself to bringing up the children of revolutionary martyrs as backbones of the Party, state and army.
					
					 She directed great attention even to the uniform of the children of revolutionary martyrs studying at Mangyongdae Revolutionary School.
					
					 Upon seeing the design of a uniform presented by officials, she personally drew up a design, saying that the uniform should be in the style of a military uniform as it is a revolutionary school uniform. She proposed letting the sleeves and trousers of the uniform wear red stripes in the clear sense that the school carried forward the revolutionary tradition of the anti-Japanese war.
					
					 An article praising her for contributing to founding of the magazine Korean Women was posted on the website of the Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea on Sept. 5.

articles.title: WPK's Founding Anniversary Observed in Czech Republic, Angola
articles.content:
WPK's Founding Anniversary Observed in Czech Republic, Angola
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in the Czech Republic and Angola on Sept. 19 on the 71st founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The chairman of the Nymburk County Committee of the Communist Party of Czech and Moravia said:
					
					 The WPK is an invincible revolutionary party which has won victories only, guided by the ideology of the great leaders under their guidance.
					
					 Its history means one of the revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					The eye-opening successes being made in the revolution and construction by the WPK and the Korean people led by Marshal Kim Jong Un are giving great strength and encouragement to all of us who are advancing under the uplifted banner of independence against imperialism and of socialism.
					
					 I wish the Korean people bigger success in their struggle for implementing the decision made at the 7th Congress of the WPK under its wise leadership.
					
					 A deputy governor of Lunda－Norte Province of Angola said that the DPRK is steadily performing world-startling miracles such as the success in the H-bomb test under the guidance of HE Kim Jong Un and a fresh event will take place in the DPRK on the threshold of the 71st founding anniversary of the WPK.

articles.title: DPRK's Founding Anniversary Marked by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
DPRK's Founding Anniversary Marked by Foreign Newspapers
 Pyongyang, September 27 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried special write-ups illustrated with photos of supreme leader Kim Jong Un from Sept. 5 to 9 on the 68th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The Ugandan newspaper Sun Rise noted in an article titled "Invincible socialist power":
					
					 The DPRK founded on Sept. 9, 1948 turned into the invincible socialist power.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il developed the DPRK into the prosperous socialist state.
					
					 Today the DPRK is more highly demonstrating its might as a political, ideological and military power.
					
					 The DPRK will shine long as the invincible socialist power.
					
					 The Egyptian newspaper Al Ahbar carried articles titled "The DPRK advancing under the banner of great Songun" and sub-titled "Law of the DPRK winning victory" and "Why is Korean-style socialism invincible?" illustrated with photos showing the invincible might of the Korean People's Army and Mirae Scientists Street.
					
					 The Myanmar newspaper The New Age edited an article titled "Self-development of the DPRK" illustrated with photos of the Sci-Tech Complex and the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm.
					
					 The Indonesian International Daily carried articles titled "The DPRK is a proud space power" and "Paradise for children" accompanied with photos showing the scene of the launch of the earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-4 and schoolchildren who are developing their talents at Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace.
					
					 The Venezuelan newspaper Vea carried an article titled "Right to preemptive nuclear strike is not a monopoly of the U.S."

articles.title: Canciller coreano se reune con sus homologos de varios paises
articles.content:
Canciller coreano se reune con sus homologos de varios paises
Pyongyang, 27 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Yong Ho, quien participo en el 71o periodo de sesiones de la Asamblea General de la ONU, departio por separado con los cancilleres de Singapur, Butan, Tailandia y Guyana, el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de Mongolia y Angola, el ministro de Estado y de Relaciones Exteriores y Cooperacion Internacional de Camboya, el vicepremier y ministro de Relaciones Exteriores y Emigracion de Siria, el ministro de Estado y ministro de Asuntos Exteriores y Cooperacion Internacional de Argelia, el ministro de Estado encargado de Asuntos Exteriores de Uganda.
					  En las ocasiones fueron discutidos los problemas de interes mutuo incluyendo el de ampliar y desarrollar las relaciones bilaterales y el de fortalecer el apoyo y cooperacion en la escena internacional.
					
					  Por otra parte, el canciller coreano se reunio respectivamente con el presidente de la Asamblea General de la ONU, el subsecretario general para la Ayuda Humanitaria de la ONU, el director ejecutivo del Programa de las Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo, el director ejecutivo del Fondo de la Poblacion de la ONU y el presidente del Comite Internacional de la Cruz Roja, para discutir el problema de cooperacion entre la RPDC y las organizaciones correspondientes.

articles.title: Efectuada reunion ampliada de 2o pleno de IX periodo del CC de la Union de Juventud
articles.content:
Efectuada reunion ampliada de 2o pleno de IX periodo del CC de la Union de Juventud 
Pyongyang, 27 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar hoy en esta capital la reunion ampliada del segundo pleno del IX periodo del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Kimilsungista-Kimjongilista. 
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion los miembros del CC y funcionarios, de la Union de la Juventud y los funcionarios de la misma en los ministerios y organos centrales.
					
					La reunion discutio las tareas de las organizaciones de la UJ para materializar las tareas presentadas en el discurso del Presidente Kim Jong Un "Abramos una era del maximo esplendor para el movimiento de la juventud kimilsungista - kimjongilista", pronunciado en el IX Congreso de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung. 
					
					El primer secretario del CC de la UJ, Jon Yong Nam, presento el informe de la ocasion y hubo discursos. 
					
					Los oradores senalaron que el discurso del Presidente Kim Jong Un sirve de enciclopedia del movimiento juvenil que ilumina la ruta para abrir la era de maximo esplendor del movimiento juvenil kimilsungista-kimjongilista de acuerdo con la demanda de la nueva era de la revolucion del Juche. 
					
					Insistieron en desarrollar la UJ como eterna organizacion juvenil de los grandes Lideres antecesores y del Presidente Kim Jong Un y manifestar plenamente su poderio como fidedigno destacamento de reserva, patrulla y unidad de flanco del Partido en la materializacion de la resolucion del VII Congreso del PTC y la del IX Congreso de la UJ. 
					
					Expusieron la decision de cumplir con su honrosa mision y deber de vanguardias juveniles en la marcha general de hoy por el cumplimiento de la causa socialista enarbolando la bandera de la Union de la Juventud Kimilsungista-Kimjongilista bajo la sabia orientacion del Presidente Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Celebran en Corea el "Dia Mundial de Turismo 2016"
articles.content:
Celebran en Corea el "Dia Mundial de Turismo 2016"
Pyongyang, 27 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 27 en el Hotel Internacional Yanggakdo el acto por el "Dia Mundial de Turismo 2016".
					  En la ocasion se efectuaron el encuentro de explicacion del turismo de Corea y la muestra de fotos.
					
					  Estuvieron presentes los funcionarios interesados y los miembros de las representaciones diplomaticas y de organizaciones internacionales, acreditadas en Corea.
					
					  Hubo intervenciones.
					
					  El director general de la Direccion Nacional de Turismo dijo que segun el proyecto del Partido del Trabajo de Corea sobre la construccion de potencia civilizada socialista, se edifican por doquier del pais numerosas instalaciones de cultura y turismo de talla mundial.
					
					  Prosiguio que cada ano, se aumenta el numero de turistas nacionales y extranjeros y se desarrolla el turismo.
					
					  Subrayo que a base de las experiencias de haber prestado servicios a las entidades de diferentes clases, dinamizara en el futuro la organizacion de actividades turisticas.
					
					  En el video-discurso enviado a todos los paises con motivo del Dia Mundial de Turismo, el secretario general de la Organizacion Mundial de Turismo, Taleb Rifai, exhorto a los gobiernos y empresas turisticas a tomar el viaje para todos como enfoque de su politica de turismo y estrategia empresarial para que todas las personas, incluyendo los discapacitados y ancianos, puedan disfrutar en el terreno la hermosura del mundo.
					
					Los participantes vieron el video "Turismo de Corea" y pasaron revista a las fotos que presentan los edificios monumentales y famosos lugares turisticos de Corea.

articles.title: Tiene lugar presentacion cientifico-tecnica nacional de rama de selvicultura
articles.content:
Tiene lugar presentacion cientifico-tecnica nacional de rama de selvicultura
Pyongyang, 27 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar los dias 26 y 27 en el Palacio de Ciencias y Tecnicas la presentacion cientifico-tecnica nacional de la rama de selvicultura bajo auspicios del Comite Central de la Federacion General de Ciencia y Tecnica de Corea.
					Participaron en la ocasion los profesores, investigadores, funcionarios y miembros del grupo de Tres Revoluciones de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, el Ministerio de Proteccion Territorial y Ambiental, el Ministerio de Selvicultura, la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, la Academia de Ciencias Agricolas, el Instituto Superior de Agricultura y Selvicultura de Kanggye,  el Instituto de Diseno de Construccion Territorial de la Provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, el Centro de Gestion Forestal de la Ciudad de Anju y otras unidades.
					
					Se presentaron las disertaciones de alto valor elaboradas por los cientificos y tecnicos y los trabajadores de la rama en el proceso de su campana para crear y proteger zonas boscosas y mejorar la administracion de las mismas.
					
					Se impartio una leccion sobre el metodo de plantar el arbol grande en todas las estaciones del ano y sobre algunos problemas surgidos en la aplicacion de agro-selvicultura.
